</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Sets skill of given unit. Unlike [[setSkill]], [[setUnitAbility]] can set values > 1. Even though the [[skill]] command will correctly return set value, the actual unit ability will be capped to max available. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> unit [[setUnitAbility]] value </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unit: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> value: [[Number]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_unit [[setUnitAbility]] 1;</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>bob [[setUnitAbility]] -[[log]] 0;
[[hint]] [[str]] [[skill]] bob; //1.#INF</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[skill]], [[setSkill]], [[CfgAISkill]], [[ArmA: AI Combat Modes|AI Combat Modes]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>
